parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name or any other identifying information. It mentions "primarul lor" (their mayor) in a general sense, discussing public opinion about a local mayor, not a parliamentary candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The hashtags #voceabotosani and #Botosani further suggest a broad geographical target.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>False. While the post discusses a mayor's performance, it does not directly advocate for or against any candidate in the parliamentary elections. The objective seems to be to report on public opinion regarding a local official, not to influence votes in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>True. The post's content aligns with citizen journalism, reporting on local issues and public sentiment.  It presents itself as gathering and sharing public opinion, not as a partisan political statement.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post does not express a personal opinion; rather, it presents itself as a report on the opinions of the residents of Nicșeni commune.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>877769664566032</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, while discussing a local mayor, does not constitute electoral propaganda related to the parliamentary elections.  It lacks any direct reference to parliamentary candidates, does not advocate for or against any specific candidate, and presents itself as a news report on public opinion. The post's objective appears to be informative rather than persuasive regarding the parliamentary elections.  The fact that it's a paid advertisement does not automatically qualify it as electoral propaganda if the content itself does not meet the criteria defined in Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>FALSE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates/>
<responsible-party-or-group>Vocea Botosani</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police/>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
